label: Hands in pockets
description: Speaker's hands or hand in pants or jacket pockets; suggests informality and limits gesture use.
scoring_guidance: Deduct in Delivery (body/professionalism). Dock points; more frequent or prolonged = larger deduction.

label: Hands clasped (in front)
description: Hands clasped together in front of body. Can be neutral if brief; prolonged or rigid suggests tension or lack of gesture.
scoring_guidance: Deduct only if prolonged or dominant. Mild/brief = small or no deduction; pronounced = deduct in Delivery.

label: Hands clasped behind
description: Hands clasped behind the back; formal or stiff posture, limits gesture.
scoring_guidance: Deduct in Delivery if prolonged; brief may be acceptable.

label: Swaying
description: Speaker sways side to side or rocks while standing; distracting and suggests lack of poise.
scoring_guidance: Deduct in Delivery (posture/body control). Severe swaying = significant deduction; minimal = small deduction.

label: Tapping hands
description: Repetitive tapping of hands together, on legs, or on podium; distracting mannerism.
scoring_guidance: Deduct in Delivery. Frequent or noticeable = moderate deduction.

label: Vocalized pause
description: Filler sounds or words: 'um', 'uh', 'like', 'you know' used as pauses.
scoring_guidance: Deduct in Delivery (vocal delivery/fluency). Many = larger deduction; few = small deduction.

label: Purpose statement
description: Clear statement of the speech goal (e.g. 'Today I will explain...', 'My goal is to persuade you that...').
scoring_guidance: Credit in Content (organization/introduction). Strong purpose statement = full or near-full points; missing or vague = deduct.

label: Eye contact with camera
description: Speaker looks at the camera lens rather than at the screen or notes; essential for connection in online/remote presentations.
scoring_guidance: Credit in Delivery when sustained. Deduct when frequently looking at screen, notes, or elsewhere instead of camera.

label: Reading from notes or screen
description: Speaker reads extensively from notes or reads text verbatim from screen; reduces engagement and eye contact with audience.
scoring_guidance: Deduct in Delivery. Heavy reliance = moderate or major deduction; occasional glance = small or no deduction.

label: Professional setup
description: Clean background, good lighting, camera at eye level; appropriate for online presentation.
scoring_guidance: Credit when well done. Minor deduct if distracting background or poor lighting.
